title: How Farmers Harvest Tons of Broccoli - Modern Agriculture Technology in Action

tasks.task: Farmers perform various steps in growing and harvesting broccoli.
subtasks: Ploughing the soil to prepare the land.
Testing and adjusting the soil pH to 6.0-7.5 for optimal nutrient absorption.
Adding organic or chemical fertilizers to promote vigorous growth.
Sowing broccoli seeds 0.5 inches deep at 12-18 inch intervals.
Transplanting seedlings from nursery trays to the field at 4-6 inches tall.
Irrigating the fields to maintain ideal moisture for germination and growth.
Monitoring temperature and humidity to support young plant growth.
Harvesting broccoli when buds are tightly closed, 6-8 inches high, using sharp knives to minimize damage.
Placing harvested broccoli on specialized equipment for quick transport.
Blanching frozen broccoli at 185-200°F for 1-3 minutes to preserve flavor and crispness.
Packaging fresh broccoli to maintain crispness and freshness.

tasks.task: Detailed care of broccoli during the growing season.
subtasks: Soil preparation including ploughing, pH testing, and fertilization.
Seed sowing and spacing.
Transplanting seedlings.
Regular irrigation and monitoring moisture levels.
Environmental monitoring and intervention (temperature/humidity).
Timely harvesting when broccoli heads are mature.
Skillful knife cutting to ensure quality.
Transporting harvested broccoli efficiently.
Blanching processes for frozen products.
Packaging methods for fresh and processed broccoli.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: The process of growing and harvesting broccoli involves several physical tasks.
subtasks: Farmers plough the soil to loosen it, remove weeds, and test the pH, adjusting it if necessary. They add fertilizers to enrich the soil. (SUBTASKS: Ploughing, pH testing, fertilizing)
Seeds are sown at a depth of 0.5 inches with proper spacing, or seedlings are transplanted from trays. (SUBTASKS: Sowing/seeding, transplanting)
Regular irrigation is maintained, and environmental conditions like temperature and humidity are closely monitored. (SUBTASK: Irrigation/monitoring)
Broccoli is harvested when mature, using knives to cut at the base. Harvested crops are placed on equipment for transport. (SUBTASKS: Harvesting, transporting)
Frozen broccoli is blanched and packaged to preserve quality; fresh broccoli is cooled and inspected for freshness. (SUBTASKS: Blanching, packaging)
